displayName.text: Elev8 Recovery Center New York: Addiction Treatment In New York

formattedAddress: 151 W 136th St, New York, NY 10030, USA
adrFormatAddress: 151 W 136th St, New York, NY 10030, USA

originalText.text: I went to visit Elev8 last week and was really inspired and moved by the care given to each client. That building is run with compassion and its really amazing to have witnessed first hand.  Keep up the great work!

text.text: I went to visit Elev8 last week and was really inspired and moved by the care given to each client. That building is run with compassion and its really amazing to have witnessed first hand.  Keep up the great work!

originalText.text: The staff here were very warm and accommodating. The atmosphere was very pleasant and friendly. Great groups that spanned a variety of helpful topics with great insight into how to overcome obstacles. Would highly recommended this place!

text.text: The staff here were very warm and accommodating. The atmosphere was very pleasant and friendly. Great groups that spanned a variety of helpful topics with great insight into how to overcome obstacles. Would highly recommended this place!

originalText.text: This place used to be nice and compassionate 4-5 years ago. I recently tried and did everything they asked me to do such as get letters from my psychiatrist and wait patiently. . Johnny Ortiz who presents himself as an intake or admission tech. He is not he's simply there to make sure your insurance can be charged the amount they want to charge it . Meanwhile, I've been trying to get into a detox for over a week now when my Drs sent all necessary paperwork to elevate.. im suffering and feel like I could die at any moment.. thanks for your lying , uncompassionate, money hungry goals. If I die he will share in the responsibility. I will say talk to a woman named Virginia if you would like clear and concise information instead of lies from Mr. Ortiz who could really care less. He's all about the money and genuinely doesn't care about the patience.

originalText.text:
New York on 136th Street Facility. This was the worst place I had ever experienced. I was never an everyday or even a every week or every mouth user, but I need that I needed some help. Initially I was picked up and supposedly headed to Urban Recovery in Brooklyn. The next thing I know this woman pulls over and parks on 136th St. at this place called Elev8. The first thing I thought I was that I was at some dieting facility. I had been in the hospital for about 7 days prior, so when I was told that if I didn't have a drug in my system, I would not be admitted. Thankfully because of my size and weight I had enough in my system to register. Upstairs there were 11 men to 3 rooms. You had to listen to RAP music all day beginning as early as 6:00AM. There was no place to go on that floor for daily reflections, peaceful meditation, or anything related to getting reground. Every where you went there were conversations about former drug use or explicit sexual encounters being glorified. I knew I was ready to stop what I was doing. I knew I didn't need to hear the sexual exploits because that definitely was my modus operandi. I wasn't proud of it anymore, because my own daughters had reached the age as the girls who were so happy to provide sexual favors for me, and that CUT INTO MY CONSCIOUSNESS. I left that horrid place, and yes, I did stumble ONE MORE TIME. After that I cried out to God. I call for a chaplain and
I earnestly begged him for the strength to give UP BOTH ILLICIT Activities and I have not looked back. The abysmal AURA I experienced at Elev8 and my prayers to God opened my eyes and heart. I never wish to be in another rehab in my life. Seriously Speaking

originalText.text: I attended the facility in Newark NJ and they saved my life. I am forever grateful for all the people and staff who cared and helped me the best they could. The best advice I can give to anyone who is considering going here for treatment is to go here with an open mind the same way we were towards our using and apply it towards the recovery process if you really want to get better. I gave 4 stars due to minor issues and the fact this place makes alot of money but the staff is underpaid which does reflect how they work. But there are alot of amazing people who will work hard and work with you if your serious about recovery. Thank you again for everything. -Lauren L.
